svg.text: This model simulates the car and pedestrian traffic at a 4-way intersection. The car lights function according to the given red/green/yellow durations, until a pedestrian arrives at any pedestrian light and presses the request button. The Berkeley policy is to serve the pedestrian immediately. Another policy, the Manhattan policy, completely ignores pedestrian requests. The time that it takes for a car to cross is defined by the CarCrossTimes. Pedestrian cross time is assumed to be 0.
